contentrichtext.text: {{about|the use of Hakim as a name|the full article on its use as a title or honorific and the distinction between '''ḥākim''' and '''ḥakīm'''|Hakim (title)}} '''Hakim''' or '''Al-Hakim''' (commonly {{lang-ar|ḥakīm/حكيم}} "wise" or ''ḥākim'' or {{lang-ar|ḥākem''/حاکم}} "ruler") is a [[male]] [[given name]]. Variant [[transliteration]]s include '''Hakam''' (or '''Al Hakam'''), '''Hakm''' (or '''Al Hakm'''), '''Hakum''' (or '''Al Hakum'''), '''Hakeem''' (or '''Al Hakeem''') and '''Hakem''' (or '''Al Hakem'''). It may refer to: ==Title or honorific== Al-Hakim ({{lang-ar|الحكيم}} ''alḥakīm'' ''wise one'' or ''doctor''), [[polymath]] scientists and philosophers who played a central role in the development of [[Science in medieval Islam]].<ref>{{Cite book|last=Nasr|first=Seyyed|middle=Hossein|title=Science and Civilization in Islam|publisher=Harvard University Press|year=1968|page=41}}</ref> This [[honorific]] is also used by the following [[Unani]] physicians: *[[Hakeem Noor-ud-Din|Hakim Noor-ud-Din]] *[[Hakim Abdul Aziz]] *[[Hakim Habibur Rahman]] *[[Hakim Mohammed Said]] *[[Hakim Syed Karam Husain]] *[[Hakim Syed Fazlur Rahman]] *[[Hakim Syed Zillur Rahman]] ===As title (laqab)=== [[Hakim (title)]] may also refer to a leader or ruler of an area. *[[Samir Geagea]], known as al-Hakim, leader of the [[Lebanese Forces]] party *[[George Habash]], known as al-Hakim, founder of the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] ==Family name== Hakim is the [[family name]] of: *[[Maximos II Hakim]] (c. 1689 – 1761), [[patriarch]] of the [[Melkite Greek Catholic Church]] from 1760 to 1761 *[[Maximos V Hakim]] (1908–2001), [[patriarch]] of the [[Melkite Greek Catholic Church]] from 1967 to 2000 *[[Naji Hakim]] (born 1955), the [[Lebanon|Lebanese-born]] composer and organist at the [[Église de la Sainte-Trinité, Paris]] *[[Peter Hakim]], American economist of Lebanese descent *[[Omar Hakim]] (born 1959), American drummer *[[Nadey Hakim]] (born 1958), British surgeon *[[Imani Hakim]], American actress *[[Yalda Hakim]], Australian journalist *[[Zahiruddin Hakim]], Mechanical engineer, [[SHERPUR,INDIAN]] ==Patronymic== Al-Hakim is the [[patronym]] or [[Kunya (Arabic)|kunya]] of: *[[Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah]], [[Fatimid]] caliph *[[Abdel-Aziz al-Hakim]], Shiite cleric and former militia leader in Iraq, President of Governing Council (2003) after the USA invasion of Iraq *[[Grand Ayatollah Muhsin al-Hakim]], the spiritual leader of the Shia world between 1955 and 1970 *[[Mohammad Said al-Hakim]], Shiite cleric and uncle of Mohammad Baqir al-Hakim *[[Mohammed Baqir al-Hakim]], Shiite cleric and the brother of Abdel-Aziz al-Hakim *[[Hakim al-Nishaburi|Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Hakim]], Islamic scholar and author of ''Ma'rifah 'Ulum al-Hadith'' *[[Tawfiq al-Hakeem]], Egyptian dramatist, novelist and thinker ==Personal name== Hakim or Hakeem is the [[personal name]] of: *[[Hakim (Egyptian singer)]], Egyptian singer *[[Hakim (Spanish singer)]], Spanish singer of Maghrebi descent *[[Hakim al-Nishaburi]], the leading hadith scholar of Olajuwon]], retired NBA basketball player *[[Hakim Warrick]], NBA basketball player for the Charlotte Bobcats *[[Hakeem Seriki]], rapper known as [[Chamillionaire]] *[[Hakim Toumi]] (born 1961), Algerian hammer thrower *[[Hakeem Noor-ud-Din]], first successor of [[Mirza Ghulam Ahmad]] and renowned scholar of 19th century [[India]] *Hakim Abol Qasim Ferdowsi Tusi, better known as [[Ferdowsi]],
